title: 2012 Recopa Sudamericana
text:
The 2012 Recopa Sudamericana (officially the 2012 Recopa <a href="Santander%20Group">Santander</a> Sudamericana for sponsorship reasons) was the 20th edition of the <a href="Recopa%20Sudamericana">Recopa Sudamericana</a>, the <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition organized by <a href="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a> between the winners of the previous season's two major <a href="South%20America">South America</a>n club tournaments, the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> and the <a href="Copa%20Sudamericana">Copa Sudamericana</a>. It was contested between <a href="Brazilian%20Football%20Confederation">Brazilian</a> club <a href="Santos%20FC">Santos</a>, the <a href="2011%20Copa%20Libertadores">2011 Copa Libertadores</a> champion, and <a href="Chilean%20Football%20Federation">Chilean</a> club <a href="Club%20Universidad%20de%20Chile">Universidad de Chile</a>, the <a href="2011%20Copa%20Sudamericana">2011 Copa Sudamericana</a> champion.
After a goalless first leg, Santos was crowned champions after their 2–0 victory in the second leg. <a href="Neymar">Neymar</a> of Santos was selected as the player of the 2012 Recopa Sudamericana.
Rules.
The Recopa Sudamericana was played over <a href="Two-legged%20tie">two legs</a>; home and away. The team that qualified via the Copa Libertadores played the second leg at home. The team that accumulated the most points —<a href="Three%20points%20for%20a%20win">three for a win</a>, one for a draw, zero for a loss— after the two legs was crowned the champion. In case of the two teams tied on points after the second leg, the team with the best <a href="goal%20difference">goal difference</a> won. If the two teams had equal goal difference, the <a href="away%20goals%20rule">away goals rule</a> was not applied. <a href="overtime%20%28sports%29">Extra time</a> was played, which consisted of two 15-minute halves. If the tie was still not broken, a <a href="penalty%20shootout%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shootout</a> ensued according to the <a href="Laws%20of%20the%20Game%20%28association%20football%29">Laws of the Game</a>.
